Back in the Spanish days, California was a hot and dry area and had been that way for 100's of years due to the effects of the ocean currents.  Then a change came to the currents and California got roughly 150 years of wet weather which brought about the farming boom.  Then the currents returned to what they were and California is basically back at the Spanish days for only a certain amount of rain per year.  But now they have an extremely large population, an unreliable water supply, and the only option available is expensive to operate and too small to actually make a difference outside the urban areas as it's too expensive to use in manufacturing or farming.

Keep in mind that according to Mercury News. California has experienced long periods of drought. Arborists have documented droughts many times in history. Here is your search line: " California drought: Past dry periods have lasted more than 200 years, scientists say." "The longest droughts of the 20th century, what Californians think of as severe, occurred from 1987 to 1992 and from 1928 to 1934. Both, Stine said, are minor compared to the ancient droughts of 850 to 1090 and 1140 to 1320." Some of these long droughts happened before there was everyday use of Organic Petroleum. That being said, Southern California is a natural desert. Recent day man brought water artificially (Normal small amounts of rain existed before) to Southern and Northern California. Then proceeded to way overpopulate the excessive naturally arid environment. In short to blame the currant and future droughts on "Global Warming created by organic fossil fuel" is just uneducated ignorance.
